department.ch: 能源工程研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
"This course is designed for senior and graduated students who are interested in computational fluid dynamics (CF). 
It provides a comprehensive understanding of solving the PDEs in fluid dynamics from physics, mathematics, and numerical technology perspectives. Programming practices are also required to further understand the numerical algorithms."
goal.en:
"This course is designed for senior and graduated students who are interested in computational fluid dynamics (CFD). 
It provides a comprehensive understanding of solving the PDEs in fluid dynamics from physics, mathematics, and numerical technology perspectives. Programming practices are also required to further understand the numerical algorithms."

outline.ch:
(1) Navier-Stokes Equations & and Reduced Equations
(2) Model Equations: Diffusion Equation, Elliptic Equation, and Wave Equation
(3) Discretization Methods: Finite Difference, Finite Volume, and spectral method
(4) Taylor Series Expansion and Truncation Error Analysis
(*) Higher Order scheme & Spectral like Scheme
(5) Richardson Extrapolation
(6) Stability, Consistency, and Convergence
(7) Stability Analysis: Fourier (Von Neumann) & Spectral method
(*) Enhancement of the Accuracy: Grid Refinement versus Higher Order Scheme
(8) Explicit & Implicit Methods
(9) Upwind and Flux Splitting Methods
(10) Concepts of Artificial Dissipation
(11) Solving Linear System of Equations:
Narrow banded Matrix: Thomas Algorithm
Different Preconditioning Techniques
(12) Eigenvector Annihilation
(13) Multigrid Method
(14) PDE in curvilinear coordinate.
(15) (Multi-block)-Structured & Unstructured Grids
(16) Compressible Flow in Conservative Form

textbook.ch:
Textbook: slices
Require Knowledge: Differential Equation, Lineal Algebra, and Computer Programming
References: 

(1) “Computational Techniques for Fluid Dynamics”, Vol I, II by C.A.J Fletcher
(2) “Numerical Computation of Internal and External Flows”, Vol. I, II by C. Hirsch
(3) “Computational Fluid Dynamics For Engineers” Vol. I by Klaus A. Hoffmann & Steve T. Chiang
(4) “Computational Fluid Dynamics. The basics with Applications”, Jon D. Anderson Jr.
